summary: Another stannis and daenerys fan. godbless. <3
question: Another stannis and daenerys fan. godbless. <3
answer:
Hello @daenerystannis!

Indeed, I am thrilled to see your URL! I have been sailing the Stannerys canoe (and creating content seemingly on my lonesome) since 2014. ;) Thank you so much for the message; I’m pleased to make your acquaintance here! <3

blog.name: oadara
blog.title: The Path to Oadara
blog.description: To go forward, I must go back and make some delicious lemon cakes.

summary: Arya: Valar Morghulis
body:
Arya: Valar Morghulis

Daenerys: Valar Dohaeris

I was just thinking that if we get this exchange between Arya and Dany, not only would it be cool but it would also be very symbolic.

Valar Morghulis=All men must die

Valar Dohaeris= All men must serve.


Given their arcs, these are remarkably relevant to each character. Arya, of course, with her Faceless Men training and Daenerys who serves the people, through her liberation of the slaves of Essos and now the people of Westeros.

Also, doesn’t Dohaeris and Daenerys sound similar. It’s almost the same spelling. Interesting.

blog.name: andthemaidenfair
blog.title: By The Old Gods and The New

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Dany growing lemon trees to remind her of the one that was outside her childhood bedroom window.  Sansa making lemon cakes out...
body:
Dany growing lemon trees to remind her of the one that was outside her childhood bedroom window. 

Sansa making lemon cakes out of the lemons Dany grows. 

Both of them living together and thriving in peaceful, supportive bliss with not an abuser in sight.

blog.name: andthemaidenfair
blog.title: By The Old Gods and The New

tags: is it just a show thing
A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: I genuinely don’t get the enmity between Sansa stans and Dany stans like where does it even come from? I think once Dany and...
body:
I genuinely don’t get the enmity between Sansa stans and Dany stans like where does it even come from? I think once Dany and Sansa got past the whole your dad killed my grandfather/ your dad helped kill my brother thing they’d be friends? And I think that they’d get past that issue fairly quickly because Dany and Sansa are both kindhearted and empathetic people in cannon. Also I feel like tragedy, loneliness and being used by others is a part of both of their narratives and they’d bond over those things?

All Sansa wants is to be happy and safe and to be surrounded by lemon cakes and all Dany truly wants is to be happy and safe in the house with the red door and the lemon tree just outside her bedroom window… the more I think about this the more I think they’d be great friends actually.

blog.name: moonlitgleek
blog.title: Welcome to the dark side
blog.description: Sam. Late twenties. Rant-aholic. Multinfandom blog. Glee, Game of Thrones\ASOIAF. Other shows include The Flash, Sense8, Grey's Anatomy, Criminal Minds, HTGAWM, Supergirl, Quantico, AHS.

tags: honestly I'd like to know what is it that Dany was expected to do in this situation
summary: Some people are saying dany killed at least an infant and 200+ bystanders when she chose to save drogon by flying away on him. I...
question: Some people are saying dany killed at least an infant and 200+ bystanders when she chose to save drogon by flying away on him. I know about the bystanders, but i think 200+ is exaggerating. And i don't honestly remember any infant. Can you please tell me if there's any truth to this claim? The people saying so are notorious dany haters, yet I could care less. But I honestly do wanna know the facts. Thanks. Have a good day!
answer:
The count is correct, the argument not so much.

Beyond the gates had been a solid press of people. Maddened by the smell of dragon, horses below reared in terror, lashing out with iron-shod hooves. Food stalls and palanquins alike were overturned, men knocked down and trampled. Spears were thrown, cross-bows were fired. Some struck home. The dragon twisted violently in the air, wounds smoking, the girl clinging to his back. Then he loosed the fire. It had taken the rest of the day and most of the night for the Brazen Beasts to gather up the corpses. The final count was two hundred fourteen slain, three times as many burned or wounded. Drogon was gone from the city by then, last seen high over the Skahazadhan, flying north.

I don’t recall any mention of an infant though but that might be a reference to the weeping child whose mother tried to protect him that Daenerys remembers in her final chapter.

However, the number isn’t the real issue in this argument; what I take issue with is the misconstruction of the incident to make it that Dany killed those people by choosing to save Drogon. A high number of casualties was inevitable from the moment that Drogon descended on Daznak’s Pit and there was nothing Dany could have done to prevent that.

Dany could see the Pahls streaming up the steps, clutching their tokars and tripping over the fringes in their haste to be away. Others followed. Some ran, shoving at one another. More stayed in their seats. One man took it on himself to be a hero.

The spearmen were running too. Some were rushing toward the dragon, spears in hand. Others were rushing away, throwing down their weapons as they fled. The hero was jerking on the sand, the bright blood pouring from the ragged stump of his shoulder. His spear remained in Drogon’s back, wobbling as the dragon beat his wings. Smoke rose from the wound. As the other spears closed in, the dragon spat fire, bathing two men in black flame. His tail lashed sideways and caught the pitmaster creeping up behind him, breaking him in two. Another attacker stabbed at his eyes until the dragon caught him in his jaws and tore his belly out. The Meereenese were screaming, cursing, howling. Dany could hear someone pounding after her. “Drogon,” she screamed. “Drogon.”

Drogon’s presence incited panic both inside and outside the pit and a great deal of trampling ensued. Many people were still in that arena, trapped with an angry dragon who loosed his fire on Dany herself and boxed in bythe  sheer number of people stacked inside and outside. An angry dragon surrounded by a great number of people, some of whom were trying to kill him was a disaster waiting to happen. It was always going to end in death.

But Dany threw herself between Drogon and the people inside Daznak’s Pit, partly to save Drogon yes but also to save those still trapped inside the pit. Drogon was killing people left and right, and while it’s possible that those trying to kill him would have eventually succeeded, it’s important to consider what the cost would have been like. Drogon would have rained hell down on everyone inside the pit before he died. One only needs to read about the dragons of the Dance to get an understanding of the level of devastation even an injured dragon is capable of. Remember that “more stayed in their seats”, so there was a lot of people in that pit for Drogon to savage. It’s also possible that Drogon might have tried to fly away at one point during the attack anyway, as Dreamfyre tried to do when the dragonpit was stormed during the Dance of the Dragons. Dragons are animals after all, so that fight or flight response is ingrained in them. Who can say that he wouldn’t have tried to fly away and killed all those people anyway?

The main point here is that Dany had no control over the situation or over Drogon. But she tried. She tried to stop the spearmen from rushing Drogon. She attracted Drogon’s attention away from them and onto herself after he started killing them. She tried to control him and take him out of the pit completely. This wasn’t a situation where Dany chose Drogon’s life over her people’s. It was one where Dany had no good options and trying to get Drogon away from Daznak’s Pit looked like the best one.

blog.name: anything-but-stydia
blog.title: Anything.but.Stydia
blog.description:
If you ship Reylo or Bughead or Harringrove or Jonsa then there’s a 100% I’ll hate you and or think you are disgusting :)

Harvey Kinkle, Jack Kline, Daenerys Targaryen >>>> all other characters

summary:
"The Night King is going to die in Episode 3"
This notion came from us being told that episode 3 will have an amazing battle -...
body:
“The Night King is going to die in Episode 3”

This notion came from us being told that episode 3 will have an amazing battle - that is the entire episode. And that GRRM has said that he doesn’t like the hole ‘good vs evil battle in the end’; like Lord of the Rings.

J*nsa shippers/Sansa stans/antis alike have taken this and ran with it. Saying that it’s an obvious sign towards dark!dany - to political!jon. That they’re going to hate each other and another Targaryen civil war will break out. But none of these people seem to mention a certain someone down south…

Cersei Lannister…

This wouldn’t be evil vs good either. It would be Jon / Dany (grey characters) vs Cersei (grey character). It’s also cannon that she’s waiting out to see who wins between the North/Dany and the Night King. Having Cersei be the ultimate villain in the end would make sense. She’s not just some magical evil force set out on world domination and destruction; nothing generic as that. It just would make sense for it to be Cersei.

Cersei would fight with her soldiers, the second sons, her navy, her ballistas, and her Wild Fire. This up against Jon/Dany, their soldiers, and dragons? It would be insane.

But I guess putting two and two together and seeing that this makes sense would interfere with shipping tactics and that’s all dark!dany and political!jon are..

J*nsa shippers/Sansa stans/antis alike have taken this and ran with it. Saying that it’s an obvious sign towards dark!dany - to political!jon. That they’re going to hate each other and another Targaryen civil war will break out. But none of these people seem to mention a certain someone down south…

Cersei Lannister…

This wouldn’t be evil vs good either. It would be Jon / Dany (grey characters) vs Cersei (grey character). It’s also cannon that she’s waiting out to see who wins between the North/Dany and the Night King. Having Cersei be the ultimate villain in the end would make sense. She’s not just some magical evil force set out on world domination and destruction; nothing generic as that. It just would make sense for it to be Cersei.

Cersei would fight with her soldiers, the second sons, her navy, her ballistas, and her Wild Fire. This up against Jon/Dany, their soldiers, and dragons? It would be insane.

But I guess putting two and two together and seeing that this makes sense would interfere with shipping tactics and that’s all dark!dany and political!jon are..
trail.content:
“The Night King is going to die in Episode 3”

This notion came from us being told that episode 3 will have an amazing battle - that is the entire episode. And that GRRM has said that he doesn’t like the hole ‘good vs evil battle in the end’; like Lord of the Rings.

J*nsa shippers/Sansa stans/antis alike have taken this and ran with it. Saying that it’s an obvious sign towards dark!dany - to political!jon. That they’re going to hate each other and another Targaryen civil war will break out. But none of these people seem to mention a certain someone down south…

Cersei Lannister…

This wouldn’t be evil vs good either. It would be Jon / Dany (grey characters) vs Cersei (grey character). It’s also cannon that she’s waiting out to see who wins between the North/Dany and the Night King. Having Cersei be the ultimate villain in the end would make sense. She’s not just some magical evil force set out on world domination and destruction; nothing generic as that. It just would make sense for it to be Cersei.

Cersei would fight with her soldiers, the second sons, her navy, her ballistas, and her Wild Fire. This up against Jon/Dany, their soldiers, and dragons? It would be insane.

But I guess putting two and two together and seeing that this makes sense would interfere with shipping tactics and that’s all dark!dany and political!jon are..

summary: Ughh, I want Jon and Arya to teach Daenerys  how to fight. It's absurd that after all the shit Dany has been trough she didn't...
body:
Ughh, I want Jon and Arya to teach Daenerys how to fight. It’s absurd that after all the shit Dany has been trough she didn’t came with the idea that maybe she needs to learn how to use a sword. You can’t depend on your dragons and other people all the tiiime.

They could also teach Sansa. Thanks.

summary: Ofc Arya and Dany are going to get along. All Dany has to do is to mention that she lives a Jon Snow appreciation life to which...
body: Ofc Arya and Dany are going to get along. All Dany has to do is to mention that she lives a Jon Snow appreciation life to which Arya will reply “me too bitch! the fuck” and then they will spent all evening sharing stories about their favourite bastard.

summary:
Just can you imagine?when Nymeria return with Arya there will be the greatest triangle with magic animals. 
Dany and Drogon
Jon...
body:
Just can you imagine?when Nymeria return with Arya there will be the greatest triangle with magic animals.

Dany and Drogon

Jon and Ghost

Arya and Nymeria.

And there will not be person in whole world more protected that this three character❤️ This three with their animals will be the most powerful allies ever after❤️
